IMPORTANT GRADUATION ANNOUNCEMENT

The Centerville Community School District has made the decision to move forward with holding an in-person graduation ceremony for the class of 2020.

The ceremony will take place on July 19th, 2020, at 7 pm on Paul Johnson Field. If students and guests are not comfortable attending the actual graduation, the graduation ceremony will be aired live on GoPitchTV’s Facebook page.

In order to provide the safest possible environment for students and their guests, CCSD will follow current CDC guidelines with regard to social distancing at social gatherings.

In the case of inclement weather, a decision will be made by 4 pm on July 19th to cancel the event and air the virtual graduation at 7 pm.

Additional details concerning the ceremony will be communicated to seniors and their families in the near future.

Three Centerville FFA members competed in the Iowa Beef Expo judging contest on Sunday Feb 10th in Des Moines. They did fantastic!

Junior, Pacey Hawkins placed 1st out of 89 FFA contestants while placing the 10 classes of cattle and had a perfect 50 out of 50 on the Performance Simmental Bulls class with a total of 579 out of 650 possible points.

Blair Wright, first time freshman contestant, placed 85th with 354 points. Blair scored a terrific score of 45 out of 50 points for the Maine-Angus Heifers class.

Junior, Aubreyonna McGill placed 68th out of 89 contestants with a total of 455 points. Aubreyonna got a 48 out of 50 for the Charolais Bred Heifer, Maine- Angus heifers, and the Performance Charolais Bulls classes.

Due to a lack of school days these kids did a great job with very little to no formal practice! Most importantly I think they had a great time and we got there and back safely! Please give them each a high five when you see them!



Go Big Reds!

Elizebeth Logsdon
